issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5utfr3dywvocowow4g4gckw4ogoswkodlb2yh749tc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oyua20ko00g8o8880oko8sc4koc0wo0izgbu4ci99c.png?nc=1)

Hide your search queries,

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180)

**Browser API**:
Block WebRTC,
Block Push API,
Block Location API

**Windows tracking**:
Disable Windows Telemetry,
Turn off Advertising ID

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | server: `System`

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/16ho0xijiiw0g4w8gookogko4g4ss0kphwb4855j00.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sy801lsz4000s8c0s0wgkwcc4s0wcg4dje2wixxao0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 5](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/iadqmo6ipq0wocgkcwggs8o0k8ggk40tpgtxpyimsg.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oljxujs1sn4w8swck4okwgow4ssswk0e96d8hnp0f4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/tkvknvqico0gw4880gs0kcokg444woseo1nz2b8zfc.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6s32hb49exgc48k8kcowg04ogowgcowbz4xhkisev4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `Android 16`
Browser: | Chrome

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

issue.title: www.nikkansports.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.youtube.com/shorts/Nz7cm-5f2tk](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fshorts%2FNz7cm-5f2tk) ### Comment > While scrolling through YouTube Shorts, the site inserts an advertisement instead of the next video. Due to my geolocation, there aren't many variations, so I've been seeing the same 5 videos on repeat for the last month. > If I open the link in a new window, the information identifying it as an ad disappears. It seems YouTube is simply slipping a promoted video into the recommendations. Even though YouTube labels it as an ad, the AdGuard script doesn't block it because it treats it as a regular video. > I hope you can do something about this, as the sheer volume of ads makes watching YouTube Shorts on PC unbearable. ``` Username: carlosj199103@gmail.com ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/76a2f28b57fd350b51001c688bb2fe2ef584f9ed

@piquark6046 Didn't I ask you to stop using such a rule? There's no reason to believe the site will never use`min-width:` for legit purpose in future. Why cut down such a good value of `min-width: 336px;`?

There is already:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/759013bef858ef3cb315031ae7f60c7f5a2778e3/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L96
So I think it's not necessary.

issue.title: www.ahead-nutrition.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.ahead-nutrition.com/products/nut-bar-coconut-almond](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ahead-nutrition.com%2Fproducts%2Fnut-bar-coconut-almond) ### Comment > Here are two active problems. > Its difficult to explain in words - so I am uploading video below as comment. > Of course I try to explain in words. > > First issue: > The deal pop-up is not working as long as Adguard for Windows is active. > > Second issue: > After Adguard for Windows is deactivated and you use the pop-up to get deal and the re-activate it - the cookie pop-up is not going away - even after Adguard for Windows is deactivated. > ...... I am able to resolve this cookie pop-up issue if I delete the active cookies while Adguard for Windows is activated - only then. ``` Username: @sonnyxq ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/qrqqbnsukmosw4k04woosk840w80408iz04glungu8.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots
